title: I am going to start weaning myself off of Firefox/Mozilla.
content: A week ago, I posted a question because I couldn't access my online bank account from Firefox. I received several notifications that indicated people had responded to me but there is nothing in my Firefox inbox or email. Please let me know when Mozilla initiates a better support network. Until then, I will be using Firefox for only inconsequential websites.
creator: amengpro55

title: Readability returns the longest html object as the most plausible if an article's header is longer than actual content
content:
When reader mode (or the standalone readability library) encounters an article on a page where a header has greater content length than the actual article or main content, then the object returned by readability will have members `content` and `textContent` matching the article header and not the actual article. This results in reader mode displaying incorrect content for a given article:

An example Blogger post where readability / reader mode work as expected: https://gnosticesotericstudyworkaids.blogspot.com/2023/11/learning-to-let-go-of-small-details-4902.html

An example Blogger page where readability / reader mode do not correctly return the article's main content: https://gnosticesotericstudyworkaids.blogspot.com/2023/11/really-understand-ego-or-anything-when.html

It appears that the logic in `_grabArtcile` is failing to nominate the actual article content as the most plausible: https://github.com/mozilla/readability/blob/main/Readability.js#L876
creator: jharringtonmn

title: Könyvjelzők
content: Mivel sok könyvjelzőt használok a Mozilla-ban, ezért csináltam egy fiókot hátha azokat is megjegyzi. Kipróbáltam a feleségem laptopján, és az összes megjelent. title: Middle click on tab bar to search or open content of a clipboard
content:
Hi everyone, long time returning user here, thanks for your help!

The default setting of middle click on new tab button (the "+") and middle click on empty space on tab bar are both "open blank new tab".

With the "browser.tabs.searchclipboardfor.middleclick" option in about:config, I am able middle click on new tab button (the "+") to open a new tab and search for the content of my clipboard at the same time.

However, I am looking to middle click on the empty space on tab bar to search for content of my clipboard. Essentially swapping the function between middle click on "+" and middle click on empty space on tab bar, when "browser.tabs.searchclipboardfor.middleclick" is set to "true".

I know how to use userChrome.css in general, but I have not figured out a way to achieve above goal...
creator: tangwualt

title: Fullscreening videos slides tabs to the right
content:
Hi, so here's the issue I have: Lets say you have 20 tabs open where the "tab scroller" becomes active and tab#17 has a video, if you enter & exit fullscreen on that tab then tabs #18-20 will slide to the right and go out of sight. This is quite annoying as I'd prefer all tabs on the right to be visible until I manually scroll to the left.

I tried googling for about:config or userChrome.css solutions but couldn't find anything, does anyone have any ideas on how to change this? Thanks.
creator: kolmar123

creator: romanazzi57

title: Youtube won't play with hardware acceleration
content:
YouTube won't start playing in Firefox. No add-ons enabled. The page is fully loaded, but clicking on Play makes nothing.

The fix is to disable "User recommended performance settings" and then disable "User hardware acceleration when available".

The problem is that hardware acceleration is enabled by default. In Edge or Chrome hardware acceleration is also enabled but it won't break YouTube.
creator: andrii.yefimchuk

title: Firefox lags after locking OS
content:
If I lock my machine for more than a few minutes and then log on again, it's always the same. I unlock my system and feel some kind of slowness in Firefox. When I switch from the currently open tab in Firefox, the new tab is highlighted in the tab bar, but the content part of the window is frozen. If I quickly open htop, I can see that the main Firefox process is suddenly using about 130% of my CPU. The only solution I have found is to quickly open htop after unlocking the system, send a SIGKILL to the main Firefox process and reopen it. This way the freezing, slowing problem is nowhere to be seen.

I am running Debian 12 with Firefox 115.4.0esr (64-bit). I have more than enough RAM and CPU.
creator: 1majom

title: Riproduzione video non funziona
content: Quando sono sulla pagina: www.corriere.it e clicco per ottenere la riproduzione di video questi partono ma appena la rotella di caricamento compie mezzo giro il video si blocca e non viene riprodotto. La riproduzione di video da altre pagine web invece funziona perfettamente. Usando altri browser i video della pagina www.corriere.it vengono riprodotti perfettamente. Ho provato a reinstallare Firefox ma senza risultato. Grazie.

title: Picture-in-Picture
content: For whatever reason the Picture-in-Picture button keeps not showing up in normal places like Prime, Netflix, Hulu, etc. I can make it come back by going to the Settings turning off the Picture-in-Picture option (Which is always still active) refreshing the settings then going back to Picture-in-Picture and turning it back on and then finally refreshing the video I was trying to use, but this is kind of a lot to have to do every time it happens and it seems to be happening more and more, so I'd like to fix the root cause instead if possible. Any ideas?
creator: maddieheth
